review: I thought that this was going to be the solution to me cutting the cord in my upstairs bedroom.  If only the fire stick could figure out whether it was connected or not.  This device is like an old annoying girlfriend.....when you think you are connected, it tells you that you are not, even though the settings says it is.  There is a disconnect between the settings and the actual stick.  Then it tells you it can't find the wifi, but every other device in the room has full connection. I even bought the NetGear WiFi extender, and still no dice.  The fire stick sits right above the extender.  I can stream anything on my iPad, or phone no problem, but I can't even get the fire stick to load the menu.  I am getting ready to call customer service to return it.I have had chromecast in the same room with no troubles what so ever.  My advice is be sure to read all the reviews.  It sounds like unless it is litterally on the TV in the room with the router, it is useless.  Many others have reported the same thing on here.  Buyer Beware.

review: I liked this more than Chromecast (I have this, chromecast, roku 3 and WD TV). It's a pain to use my cell phone all the time to change things. For example, if I'm watching something and someone calls my cell phone... it's hard to pause and answer the call. This thing has a remote that works great. I hooked this thing up to my projector to get rid of the HDMI cables. Now I can watch movies and i don't have any cables going to my PC. I never had any issues with Hulu or Netflix. Definitely enjoyed this product. Good job, Amazon!
